properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 7 at 6:55AM PST until January 7 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. Total tide near 10.5
feet.

* WHERE...South Washington Coast.

* WHEN...Around the high tides at 10 AM.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level,
during high tide is expected in the low lying areas near bays,
sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. In south
Washington coast, similar conditions in the past have resulted
in minor flooding in Raymond, on HWY 101 near South Bend, and/or
minor erosion of HWY 105 near North Cove.
properties.instruction:
A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

NWSheadline: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT 9 AM UNTIL NOON PST TODAY FOR MINOR TIDAL OVERFLOW ALONG LOW LYING SECTIONS OF THE SOUTH WASHINGTON COAST
